metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1974 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernel's NFC corefunctionality due to a race condition between kobject creation and delete.This vulnerability allows a local attacker with CAP_NET_ADMIN privilege toleak kernel information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1974` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-lowlatency - 4.4.0-239.273
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-192-generic - 4.15.0-192.203~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-192-generic - 4.15.0-192.203~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-192-lowlatency - 4.15.0-192.203~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1118-kvm - 4.4.0-1118.128
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1155-aws - 4.4.0-1155.170
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1140-aws - 4.15.0-1140.151~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1150-azure - 4.15.0-1150.165~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1135-gcp - 4.15.0-1135.151~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1105-oracle - 4.15.0-1105.116~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-239.273').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-192.203~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1118.128').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1155.170').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1140.151~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1150.165~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1135.151~16.04.2').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1105.116~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
